intro: Taraxacum alatum, commonly known as the winged dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, wing-like bracts that surround the flower head, giving it its common name. The plant produces a yellow flower head that develops into a white, fluffy seed head, typical of the dandelion genus. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Taraxacum alatum is a perennial herb that grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters.
